name: StartStopScheduledTask
description: This task allows users to start/stop windows Scheduled Task using powershell command Stop-ScheduledTask or Start-ScheduledTask. It doesn't need admin privilege or share folder on the target machine.
author: ShahyadS

inputs.name: TaskName
inputs.label: Task Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of a Task in Windows Task Scheduler

inputs.name: Action
inputs.label: Action for the Task
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the action: Start, Stop

inputs.name: UserName
inputs.label: Login
inputs.helpMarkDown:
a userid for the target machine with required access rights.
(e.g. domain\username)

inputs.name: MachineNameslist
inputs.label: semicolon separated list of machine names
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the machines on which the task is created (e.g. serverName1;serverName2;serverName3)
